sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: How (BKSY) Movements Inform Risk Allocation Models
feed.summary: This article analyzes Blacksky Technology Inc. Class A (NASDAQ: BKSY) using AI models, indicating strong sentiment across all horizons and an overweight bias. It outlines distinct trading strategies (Position, Momentum Breakout, Risk Hedging) tailored to different risk profiles, offering targets and stop losses. The analysis highlights an exceptional 119.7:1 risk-reward setup targeting a 33.6% gain against 0.3% risk.

feed.title: BlackSky accelerates Gen-3 satellite into full commercial service in three weeks
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. has successfully brought its third Gen-3 imaging satellite into commercial service just three weeks after launch, significantly reducing commissioning time. This new satellite enhances capacity for 35-centimeter-class very high-resolution imagery and AI-enabled analytics for global customers. The company plans to regularly expand the Gen-3 constellation to increase capacity, reduce latency, and broaden applications for rapid situational understanding.

feed.title: Understanding Momentum Shifts in (BKSY)
feed.summary: This article analyzes Blacksky Technology Inc. (BKSY), highlighting strong sentiment across all horizons and an exceptional risk-reward short setup. It details three institutional trading strategies tailored for different risk profiles: a position trading strategy, a momentum breakout strategy, and a risk hedging strategy, all derived from AI models. The analysis also provides multi-timeframe signal strengths with support and resistance levels.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology Inc.'s (NYSE:BKSY) P/S Is Still On The Mark Following 38% Share Price Bounce
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. (NYSE:BKSY) has seen a 38% share price bounce in the last month, contributing to a 74% increase over the last year. Despite a high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 6.4x compared to the industry average of 1.3x, analysts are optimistic about the company's future revenue growth, forecasting a 31% annual increase over the next three years, significantly outperforming the broader industry's 6.5% forecast. This strong outlook justifies the current high P/S ratio, indicating investor confidence in its future performance.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology enters $100M sales agreement
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology (NYSE: BKSY) has entered into a significant sales agreement valued at $100 million. This deal underscores the company's growth in the satellite intelligence sector.

feed.title: Selling US$1.8m Of Stock Was Lucrative Decision For BlackSky Technology Insiders
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. insiders sold US$1.8 million worth of stock in the past year, with the CEO making the largest single sale of US$550k. This selling activity, especially below the current stock price, suggests potential weakness or that insiders believe the shares are fully valued. Despite this, insiders still own about 4.2% of the company, indicating some alignment with shareholders, but the consistent selling warrants caution for potential investors.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology (BKSY): Evaluating Valuation After Major Gen-3 ISR Contract Win and Expansion News
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology (BKSY) recently secured a multi-year contract exceeding $30 million for Gen-3 tactical ISR services, highlighting increased demand for its AI-powered space intelligence. Despite recent share price volatility with a 19.98% drop over the past month, the company boasts a strong long-term performance with a 1-year total shareholder return of 197.23%. Analysts consider BlackSky undervalued, with a fair value of $27.29 per share compared to its current $20.42, anticipating significant revenue growth and profitability shifts due to its Gen-3 satellite constellation expansion.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology (BKSY): Valuation in Focus After $30M Defense Contract Win
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology secured a multi-year contract worth over $30 million for its Gen-3 tactical ISR services, highlighting its growth in the defense intelligence market. Despite recent stock volatility and a sharp drop, the company's shares have shown a strong year-to-date return, stirring debate about its valuation. The article explores different valuation perspectives, including an "undervalued" narrative with a fair value of $27.29 and a revenue multiples view cautioning about high Price-to-Sales ratios.

feed.title: Behavioral Patterns of BKSY and Institutional Flows
feed.summary: This article analyzes Blacksky Technology Inc. Class A (NASDAQ: BKSY) using AI models, highlighting weak near- and mid-term sentiment but a strong long-term outlook. It presents three distinct trading strategies—Position, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—with specific entry, target, and stop-loss levels. The analysis also details support and resistance signals across various time horizons, emphasizing an exceptional risk-reward setup.

feed.title: Why BlackSky Technology (BKSY) Is Up After Securing a $30 Million Multi-Year International Defense Contract
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology (BKSY) has secured a multi-year international defense contract worth over $30 million for its Gen-3 tactical ISR services, boosting its presence in space-based intelligence and highlighting the demand for AI-powered satellite imagery. This follows a significant contract with the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency worth up to $290 million, emphasizing the growing need for BlackSky's advanced analytics. The company is projected to reach $230.4 million in revenue by 2028, with a fair value indicating a 45% upside to its current price, although investors note the challenge of converting early access agreements into long-term commitments.

feed.title: BlackSky Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. reported its third-quarter 2025 results, highlighting over $60 million in new contract awards driven by strong international demand for space-based intelligence solutions. The company maintained its 2025 outlook and increased its cash balance to $147.6 million, anticipating a strong Q4 and momentum into 2026. Financial highlights included total revenue of $19.6 million and a backlog of $322.7 million, with 91% from international contracts.

feed.title: Space Stock Tracker—BlackSky, Redwire Dump After Earnings; AST, Rocket Lab On Deck
feed.summary: This article discusses the performance of several space stocks, including BlackSky and Redwire, which saw declines after their earnings reports. It also highlights upcoming earnings reports for AST SpaceMobile and Rocket Lab, and the re-nomination of Jared Isaacman as NASA Administrator.

feed.title: BLACKSKY TECHNOLOGY Earnings Results: $BKSY Reports Quarterly Earnings
feed.summary: BLACKSKY TECHNOLOGY ($BKSY) reported its quarterly earnings on November 6, 2025, exceeding EPS estimates with -$0.35 per share against an estimated -$0.48. However, the company missed revenue estimates, reporting $19,620,000 compared to an estimated $29,037,931. The article also details recent insider trading activity, institutional holdings changes, and analyst ratings and price targets for $BKSY.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology Holds Annual Stockholders Meeting
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. held its annual stockholders meeting on September 10, 2025, where key decisions were made, including the election of directors and approval of executive compensation. The company's stock (BKSY) currently has a Hold rating from analysts with a $17.00 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates BKSY as Neutral due to financial challenges despite positive developments like international growth.

feed.title: Ward Tracy, SVP at BlackSky, sells $11,883 in shares - Investing.com India
feed.summary: This article reports that Ward Tracy, Senior Vice President at BlackSky, sold shares of the company worth $11,883. The article content, however, indicates an application error, preventing further details about the transaction from being displayed.

feed.title: Ward Tracy, SVP at BlackSky, sells $11,883 in shares - Investing.com
feed.summary: This article reports on a client-side application error encountered while attempting to load content related to Ward Tracy, an SVP at BlackSky, selling $11,883 in shares. The intended content about insider trading at BlackSky is not displayed due to the error. There are no details available about the transaction itself.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology : Amendment to Statement of Changes in Beneficial Ownership (Form 4/A) - MarketScreener
feed.summary: This article reports on an amendment to a Statement of Changes in Beneficial Ownership (Form 4/A) filed by Henry Edward Dubois, Chief Financial Officer of BlackSky Technology Inc. The amendment corrects details regarding the sale of 29,943 shares of Class A Common Stock at a price of $17.45 per share on September 12, 2025, to cover statutory tax withholding obligations. After the transaction, Dubois beneficially owned 476,285 shares.

feed.title: Blacksky Technology stock hits 52-week high at 31.88 USD By Investing.com - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: The article reports that Blacksky Technology stock reached a new 52-week high of $31.88 USD. However, due to an application error on the website, the full content of the news story is not available.

feed.title: BlackSky to Host Third Quarter 2025 Results Conference Call - MarketScreener
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. will host a conference call on November 6, 2025, at 8:30 a.m. EST to discuss its third-quarter 2025 financial results and business outlook. A press release will be issued on the same day prior to the call. The event will include a live webcast and will be archived on the company's investor relations website.

feed.title: Aechelon + partners Niantic Spatial, ICEYE, BlackSky and Distance debut Project Orbion
feed.summary: Aechelon Technology has announced 'Project Orbion,' a new initiative to create a live Digital Twin of the Earth using advanced technologies from partners Niantic Spatial, ICEYE, BlackSky, and Distance. This project integrates real-time satellite imagery, radar intelligence, video photogrammetry, and AI to reconstruct and distribute the world in dynamic 3D, complete with accurate physics and real-time weather. Project Orbion aims to enhance situational awareness for various applications, from disaster monitoring to defense, and train cutting-edge AI models with real-world, ground-truth data.

feed.title: BlackSky Announces Pricing of Upsized $160 Million Convertible Senior Notes Offering
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. has announced the pricing of an upsized $160 million offering of 8.25% Convertible Senior Notes due 2033 in a private offering. The notes will mature on August 1, 2033, and are convertible into cash, shares of BlackSky's Class A common stock, or a combination thereof, at the company's election. BlackSky plans to use approximately $113.3 million of the net proceeds to repay and terminate existing secured loan facilities, with the remainder allocated for general corporate purposes.

feed.title: BlackSky Announces Proposed Private Offering of $125 Million of Convertible Senior Notes
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. announced a proposed private offering of $125 million in Convertible Senior Notes due 2033, with an option for initial purchasers to buy an additional $18.75 million. The company plans to use the net proceeds to repay and terminate its secured term loan and revolving credit facilities, with the remainder for general corporate purposes. The notes will be general unsecured obligations convertible into cash, shares of BlackSky’s Class A common stock, or a combination thereof.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology reports preliminary Q2 results and lowers 2025 outlook
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. reported preliminary unaudited Q2 and H1 2025 financial results, showing a decrease in Q2 revenue but an increase for the first half of the year, alongside a stronger cash position. The company revised its full-year 2025 revenue guidance downward due to U.S. Government budget uncertainties, while maintaining long-term targets and capital expenditures. This comes after recent convertible senior notes offerings and new international client contracts, with analysts maintaining positive outlooks.

feed.title: BlackSky Announces Proposed Private Offering of $125 Million of Convertible Senior Notes
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. (NYSE: BKSY) announced its intention to offer $125 million in Convertible Senior Notes due 2033 in a private offering. The company plans to use the net proceeds primarily to repay and terminate its existing secured term loan facility and secured revolving credit facility, with the remainder allocated for general corporate purposes. The notes will be general unsecured obligations and convertible into cash, shares of Class A common stock, or a combination thereof at BlackSky's election.

feed.title: BlackSky stock plunges after announcing $125 million convertible notes offering
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. (NYSE: BKSY) saw its stock plunge over 20% in after-hours trading following the announcement of a private offering of $125 million in convertible senior notes due 2033. The company plans to use the proceeds primarily to repay outstanding borrowings and terminate its secured term loan and revolving credit facilities, with the remainder allocated for general corporate purposes. The notes will be unsecured and convertible into cash, Class A common stock, or a combination, at BlackSky's discretion.

feed.title: BlackSky Announces Proposed Private Offering of $125 Million of Convertible Senior Notes
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. (NYSE: BKSY) has announced a proposed private offering of $125 million in Convertible Senior Notes due 2033. The company intends to use a significant portion of the net proceeds, approximately $103.1 million and $10.2 million, to repay and terminate its secured term loan and revolving credit facilities, respectively, with the remainder allocated for general corporate purposes. This offering is aimed at institutional buyers and is subject to market conditions.

feed.title: BlackSky Announces Pricing of Upsized $160 Million Convertible Senior Notes Offering
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. announced the pricing of an upsized private offering of $160 million in 8.25% Convertible Senior Notes due 2033. The company also granted initial purchasers an option for an additional $25 million in notes. Net proceeds from the offering, estimated at $153.7 million, will primarily be used to repay and terminate existing secured term loan and revolving credit facilities, with the remainder for general corporate purposes.

feed.title: BlackSky to expand constellation to deliver high-cadence, multi-spectral broad area collection capabilities
feed.summary: BlackSky announced plans to expand its high-frequency monitoring constellation with new multispectral, large-area collection satellites, initially designated AROS. These satellites, planned for launch as early as 2027, will support country-scale digital mapping, navigation, maritime, and 3D digital twin applications. AROS is designed to fill market gaps as legacy satellites age, offering increased capabilities, disruptive speed, and favorable economics.

feed.title: Space Stocks Weekly Countdown: RocketLab, Blacksky, Redwire & More
feed.summary: This article provides an update on several key space stocks, highlighting recent contract wins, product launches, and financial performance. Rocket Lab is set to launch a BlackSky Gen-3 satellite, while BlackSky reported strong Q1 2025 results. Sidus Space launched its Fortis VPX computing system, and Redwire shares soared following news of its contributions to the European Space Agency's Comet Interceptor mission and a new contract for ESA's Next Generation Gravity Mission satellites.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: BlackSky Technology Q1 2025 sees 24% stock surge
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology reported a strong Q1 2025 with a 22% revenue increase to $29.5 million and secured $130 million in new contracts, driving a 24.37% stock surge. The company maintained its full-year guidance for 2025 with projected revenue between $125 million and $142 million and plans to expand its Gen three satellite constellation to 12 by early 2026. CEO Brian O’Toole highlighted advancements in AI and automation, emphasizing the company's strategic positioning to meet increasing demand for space-based intelligence solutions.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology Inc. Class A (BKSY) reports earnings
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. Class A (BKSY) has filed its annual report for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2024, showing total revenue of $102.1 million, an increase from the previous year. The growth was driven by higher sales in imagery and software analytical services and professional and engineering services, despite reporting a net loss of $57.2 million. The company also highlighted its acquisition of the remaining 50% of LeoStella LLC and a backlog of $261.7 million indicating future revenue.

feed.title: BlackSky Announces 1-for-8 Reverse Stock Split of Class A Common Stock
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. announced a 1-for-8 reverse stock split of its Class A common stock, effective September 6, 2024, with trading on a split-adjusted basis beginning September 9, 2024. The reverse split, approved by stockholders, will adjust outstanding options, restricted stock units, and warrants proportionately. No fractional shares will be issued, with stockholders receiving cash payments in lieu thereof.

feed.title: Wilson Sonsini Advises BlackSky on $46 Million Follow-On Offering
feed.summary: Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati advised BlackSky Technology Inc. on the closing of its underwritten public offering, which generated approximately $46 million in gross proceeds. BlackSky sold 10,000,000 shares of its Class A common stock at $4.00 per share, with underwriters fully exercising an option for an additional 1,500,000 shares. The funds were raised before deducting underwriting discounts and offering expenses.

feed.title: BlackSky Technology Falls After Public Offering Announcement
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology's shares declined following the announcement of a $40 million public offering. The offering includes 10 million shares, with an additional 1.5 million shares potentially available for underwriters. The offering is anticipated to close around September.

feed.title: SHAREHOLDER ALERT: Purcell & Lefkowitz LLP Is Investigating BlackSky Technology Inc. for Potential Breaches of Fiduciary Duty By Its Board of Directors
feed.summary: Purcell & Lefkowitz LLP, a class action law firm, has initiated an investigation into BlackSky Technology Inc. for potential breaches of fiduciary duty by its board of directors. The firm specializes in representing shareholders nationwide. This alert was issued via PR Newswire on August 30, 2023.

feed.title: BlackSky Announces $29.5 Million Private Placement Financing
feed.summary: BlackSky Technology Inc. announced it has raised $29.5 million through a private placement of Class A common stock and warrants to institutional investors. The company intends to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes and investments in its space and software platforms. The private placement involves the sale of 16,403,677 shares at $1.79 per share, with an equivalent number of warrants at an exercise price of $2.20.

feed.title: BlackSky Achieves World’s Highest Revisit, Time-Diverse Dawn-to-Dusk Satellite Constellation with Three Successful Launches in Three Weeks
feed.summary: BlackSky has achieved the world's highest revisit satellite constellation with a peak rate of 15 hourly visits per day, following the successful launch of six satellites across three missions in less than 30 days. This expansion brings their total constellation to 12 small satellites, significantly increasing imaging capacity and enabling their Spectra AI platform to deliver real-time geospatial intelligence. CEO Brian E. O’Toole highlights the company's rapid deployment capability and readiness to scale services for strong commercial and government market demand.

feed.title: BlackSky appoints Amy Minnick as chief commercial officer
feed.summary: BlackSky (NYSE: BKSY) has appointed Amy Minnick as its Chief Commercial Officer to lead the expansion of its global footprint across various vertical markets. Ms. Minnick brings over two decades of experience in go-to-market optimization, product strategy, and business transformation, and will focus on driving commercial growth, particularly in AI-driven geospatial intelligence. Her role will be crucial in accelerating BlackSky's position in real-time global intelligence.
